title: How to Get to the Kindle Home Screen on the E-Reader, App, & Web

steps.title: Tap the upper 1/4th of your screen.
steps.content: Tap the upper 1/4th of your screen. If you tap the right place, a menu will expand at the top. If you don't tap high enough, your Kindle will turn to the next page. If this happens, tap the left side of your screen to go back one page, then tap closer to the top of your Kindle's screen. These steps will work on any modern Kindle e-reader, including the Paperwhite and Scribe. Older Kindle e-readers may have a slightly different layout.

steps.title: Tap the back arrow in the top-left corner of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the back arrow in the top-left corner of the screen. If you opened your book from the Home screen, the back button will say Home . If you opened your book from the Library screen, the back button will say Library .

steps.title: Tap the Home button (if necessary).
steps.content: Tap the Home button (if necessary). If the back button in Step 2 said Home , you can skip this step as you'll already be at the Home screen. If the back button in Step 2 said Library , simply tap the Home button at the bottom of your screen. [1] X Research source If you are in one of the Kindle's menus and not in a book, you can get back to the home screen by clicking the X button to close out of the menu.

steps.title: Tap in the middle of the screen.
steps.content: Tap in the middle of the screen. When using the Kindle app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad, tapping anywhere in the middle of the screen will zoom out on the page, giving you some extra options. If you tap on the left or right edge of your screen or accidentally swipe instead of tap, you'll just turn the page. Simply tap on the opposite edge or swipe the screen to get back to the page you were on.

steps.title: Tap the < button.
steps.content: Tap the < button. It's in the top left corner.

steps.title: Tap the Home button (if necessary).
steps.content: Tap the Home button (if necessary). If you opened your book from the Home screen, you will be returned to the Home screen, and you can skip this step. However, if you opened your book from the Library screen, you'll need to tap Home at the bottom of the screen to go back to the Home screen. If you're in the More tab, tap the Home button at the bottom of the screen to move to the Home page. If you're in one of the menus on the More page, tap the X button to exit the menu, then tap Home at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over the top or bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over the top or bottom of the screen. When you do this, an overlay will appear over the book, giving you more options.

steps.title: Click Kindle Library.
steps.content: Click Kindle Library . It's in the upper-left corner of the screen. Unlike a Kindle device or the Kindle app on your phone or tablet, there is no Home screen on the Kindle web reader. If you're using Kindle on the web, the Library screen is effectively your Home screen. This is because the Home screen on Kindle devices and/or the Kindle app shows the books in your Library and also suggests new books to purchase from Amazon's Kindle e-book marketplace. On the web, you can simply go to amazon.com or click the cart button in the upper-right corner to go to the Kindle Store.

steps.title: What's the difference between the Kindle Home and Library?
steps.content: What's the difference between the Kindle Home and Library? On Kindle e-readers and the Kindle app, the Home screen shows you recent books from your Library, as well as suggestions for books to buy from the Kindle Store (such as new releases, popular books, and recommendations based on your Library). The Library screen shows you all of the books you have on your Kindle. On the Kindle web reader, there is no Home page, and you only have a Library screen.

steps.title: How do I switch between books on my Kindle?
steps.content: How do I switch between books on my Kindle? To switch between books on your Kindle, first exit the book you are currently reading. You can then open a book from the Home or Library screen to start reading it instead. Unfortunately, there's no fast switch option to switch between books.

steps.title: What does the arrow at the top of my Kindle screen do?
steps.content: What does the arrow at the top of my Kindle screen do? On Kindle devices, the arrow at the top of your screen pulls down a drawer with various settings, but it does not have a button to get to the Kindle Home screen.
